channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: National Guard member dies from injuries. And, death toll in Hong Kong fire rises
item.description: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-r...

item.title: What will holiday shopping say about the state of America? An expert hunts for clues
item.description: Retail expert Katie Thomas scours her local shopping mall in Pittsburgh to divine what Americans' shopping habits reveal about the economy and the nat...

item.title: Israeli forces kill at least 10 in southern Syria raid, officials and residents say
item.description: Syria's foreign ministry said in a statement Friday that the attack was "a horrific massacre" and said women and children were among those killed.

item.title: A bright spot for turtles: Olive ridleys are recovering in India, but still at risk
item.description: India's olive ridley turtle numbers appear to have rebounded after years of patchwork efforts to stem their decline. Can it last?

item.title: The DOT says it wants to make trucking safer, but some see an 'immigration raid'
item.description: The Department of Transportation wants tougher rules for commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say...

item.title: Two former Peruvian presidents jailed in two days
item.description: Pedro Castillo and Martín Vizcarra are the latest in a series of Peruvian presidents to be sent to prison.

item.title: Trump vows to ‘permanently pause’ migration from poor nations in anti-immigrant social media screed

item.description: New evidence discovered after Murdaugh murders reignites a cold case. "48 Hours" obtains findings of independent forensic experts. CBS News national c...

item.title: Runaway nuns can stay in Alpine convent if they leave social media
item.description: The three nuns say they were taken out of the convent against their will and placed in a care home.

item.title: Anti-corruption agents raid home of top aide to Ukraine's Zelenskyy
item.description: Ukrainian anti-corruption officials raid the home of a top aide to President Zelenskyy in connection with a major probe into an energy sector corrupti...

item.title: Trump says US will pause migration from 'third-world countries'
item.description: The president did not name which countries would be affected, but vowed to remove anyone "not a net asset" to the US.

item.title: Have a CD account set to mature in 2026? Here's what experts recommend doing now.
item.description: If you're nearing the end of your CD term, there are a few simple but important steps you may want to take now.

item.title: Ukraine anti-corruption agents search home of Zelensky's top adviser
item.description: Andriy Yermak has played a crucial role in Ukraine's response to Russia's war and is lead negotiator in peace talks.

item.title: Hong Kong apartment blaze finally doused, but death toll keeps rising

item.title: Hong Kong tower blocks fire death toll rises to 128
item.description: Authorities say 89 bodies are unidentified and 79 people remain injured after Wednesday's blaze.

item.title: Solve this case: Who killed Kay Wenal?

item.title: Refugee groups worry about backlash after shooting of National Guard soldiers in DC
